thread.title: ‘It really is a miracle’ and other remarkable quotes of the week
thread.title_full: ‘It really is a miracle’ and other remarkable quotes of the week

author: The Dallas Morning News
title: ‘It really is a miracle’ and other remarkable quotes of the week
text:
“It really is a miracle … that they got everyone out .” — Trisha Ferguson, aviation industry expert and the chief executive of The Interaction Group, a company that designs airplane safety cards, commenting on a Japan Airlines flight that burst into flames after colliding with another aircraft. (Monday, The New York Times ) “ These payments were made while these governments were promoting specific foreign policy goals with the Trump administration and even, at times, with President Trump himself, and as they were requesting specific actions from the United States to advance their own national policy objectives.” — A report from Democrats in the House Oversight Committee detailing $7.8 million in receipts from government officials in China, Saudi Arabia, Qatar and other countries to former President Donald Trump’s businesses while he was in office. (Thursday, The Washington Post )
Advertisement “I got a chance to visit with Jimmy during the week leading up to it, before he got to Dallas and then saw him before the game. And it was pretty obvious that this, this meant a lot to him . And I thought he was fantastic and what he had to say. And it was good to see he and Jerry together. I do feel like whatever differences they’ve had, I do believe that that’s in the past, which is good for all of us.” — Dallas Cowboys legend Troy Aikman describing the induction of former head coach Jimmy Johnson into the Cowboys Ring of Honor. (Thursday, Sportsradio 96.7 FM/1310 The Ticket)
Advertisement “Family court judges are more prone to experience threats or violence mainly because they are dealing with highly emotional family matters such as child custody and claims of domestic violence.” — James T. Richardson, a professor of sociology and judicial studies at the University of Nevada, Reno, after a viral video showed defendant attacking Judge Mary Kay Holthus. (Thursday, NPR )
